task.title: Install Eucalyptus from Release Packages
task.shortdesc: To install Eucalyptus from release packages, perform the tasks listed in this topic.

step.cmd: Configure the Eucalyptus package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component:

info.p: Enter y when prompted to install this package.

step.cmd: (Optional) If you are a Eucalyptus subscriber, you will receive two rpm package files containing your license for subscription-only components. Install these packages on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component.

substep.cmd: Install the license files to access the enterprise repository.

step.cmd: Configure the Euca2ools package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component or Euca2ools:

info.p: Enter y when prompted to install this package.

step.cmd: Configure the EPEL package repository on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component or Euca2ools:

info.p: Enter y when prompted to install this package.

step.cmd: If you are installing on RHEL 6, you must enable the Optional repository in Red Hat Network for each NC, as follows:

substep.cmd: Go to http://rhn.redhat.com and navigate to the system that will run the NC.
Make sure the RHEL Server Optional checkbox is checked.
Install the Eucalyptus node controller software on each planned NC host:
Remove the default libvirt network. This step allows the eucanetd dhcpd server to start.

info.codeblock: virsh net-destroy default virsh net-autostart default --disable

substep.cmd: Check that the KVM device node has proper permissions.

info.p: Verify the output shows that the device node is owned by user root and group kvm.
If your kvm device node does not have proper permissions, you need to reboot your NC host.

step.cmd: If you plan to run in Edge networking mode, install the package for Edge support on each planned NC host.
On each planned CLC host, install the Eucalyptus cloud controller software.
Install the services image package on the machine hosting the primary CLC:
step.info: This will install worker images for both the Load Balancer and Imaging services.

step.cmd: Install the software for the remaining Eucalyptus components. The following example shows most components being installed on the same host. We recommend that you use different hosts for each component:
If you are a subscriber and use SAN, run the appropriate command for your device on each machine hosting a CLC:
If you are a subscriber and use SAN, run the appropriate command for your device on each machine hosting a SC:
After you have installed Eucalyptus, test multicast connectivity between each CLC and Walrus, and SC.

substep.cmd: Install the network tomography package on the Cloud Controller, Cluster Controller, Storage Controller, and any machines running Walrus.
Run the network-tomography tool on the Cloud Controller, Cluster Controller, Storage Controller, and any machines running Walrus, passing a list of IP addresses for each of these machines.
substep.info: /usr/bin/network-tomography 192.168.51.174 192.168.51.196 192.168.51.86 192.168.51.99 This tool may take up to an hour to run. Check the output for reports of packet loss. If there is significant packet loss, ensure that your network is available and multicast enabled.

taskbody.postreq: You are now ready to Configure Eucalyptus.
